name: css-modules-companion
description: Utilities for working with CSS Modules

css-modules-companion.fileExtension.description: The file extension to use when searching for or creating a corresponding CSS module file.  If set to "auto", the extension will attempt to identify whatever CSS preprocessor appears to be in use the current workspace.

commands.title: Toggle Between Component and Corresponding CSS Module
commands.enablement: editorTextFocus && (editorLangId == typescript || editorLangId == typescriptreact || editorLangId == javascript || editorLangId == javascriptreact || resourceFilename =~ /\.module\.(css|scss|sass|less|styl)$/)

commands.title: Import Corresponding CSS Module
commands.enablement: editorTextFocus && (editorLangId == typescript || editorLangId == typescriptreact || editorLangId == javascript || editorLangId == javascriptreact)

keybindings.when: editorTextFocus && (editorLangId == typescript || editorLangId == typescriptreact || editorLangId == javascript || editorLangId == javascriptreact || resourceFilename =~ /\.module\.(css|scss|sass|less|styl)$/)
editorTextFocus && (editorLangId == typescript || editorLangId == typescriptreact || editorLangId == javascript || editorLangId == javascriptreact)
